instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello, 
Looking for some help here , This macbook came  in dead , customer stated that it was charging and left connected overnight then the next day the computer was not coming on , I opened it and found <CHIP>U4910</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4920</CHIP> were both fried to ashes, When i ran a quick Diode mode only in that area I found that power rail <SIGNAL>PP1V8_MESA</SIGNAL> was fully shorted to ground , I then removed and replaced <CHIP>U4910</CHIP> And <CHIP>U4920</CHIP> and the short was gone , but the computer is still not  booting . I  measured <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> in diode mode and I got a value of 0.388 and in   voltage mode I am getting 12.25 V but my amp meter is still reading 5V I have not changed The USB Controller chips <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> OR <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>
Please advice that would be highly appreciated.

Thank you very much

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
The resistors have resistance; the capacitance is unwanted for any resistor.
The capacitance is the basic property of the capacitors.

0 ohm resistor can be replaced by a tiny cable; 0.03-0.1 mm is good enough.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
With charger alone, you can't get 10V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>!
Its voltage comes from USB-C input, which can be 5V, or 20V.
As I already explained, if you really get 10V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> (same as <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>), then <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> (<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>) MUST be 2.5V aprox.
Some of the readings posted before, must be wrong.

You can get 10V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> only from system side (F7000), through <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40; if battery has 10V then.
ONLY if <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> is bad, or incorrect controlleed by <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
And I repeat, you can't get 1.26V at <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> with 10V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.

No need to change <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> if measure 0 ohm...
